Disorders of Environmental Origin/Wounds and Injuries/Craniocerebral Trauma/Cerebrospinal Fluid Otorrhea
Disorders of Environmental Origin/Wounds and Injuries/Trauma, Nervous System/Craniocerebral Trauma/Cerebrospinal Fluid Otorrhea
Record.Description: Discharge of cerebrospinal fluid through the external auditory meatus or through the eustachian tube into the nasopharynx. This is usually associated with CRANIOCEREBRAL TRAUMA (e.g., SKULL FRACTURE involving the TEMPORAL BONE;), NEUROSURGICAL PROCEDURES; or other conditions, but may rarely occur spontaneously. (From Am J Otol 1995 Nov;16(6):765-71)
